page.title: 04Where We Live-Stamford Br.
page.content: Most of the houses in Stamford Bridge have been built since world war 2.Before that there were only a few houses in Main Street and in the surrounding countryside.These were very old,over a hundred years.Especially the farm houses in High and Low Catton.In 1947 more houses were built including the council houses in the Crescent.By the 1960s the estate on the road to Low Catton was being built as well as housing on Viking Road.More council houses were built in 1953.Baretts the house_builders started another new estate in the 1970s.By the 1980s they were building the Burtonfields Estate on the road to Bridlinton.Most of the houses in Stamford Bridge are owner occupied but some people prefer to rent from the council.Domestic fuel is electricity and oil,no mains gas.
